creator: aaron@pangonetworks.com
text:
This is actually a pretty simple one:
DefaultUserAgent() has getEventDispatcher() which always returns null.  When 
JSVGCanvas() uses DefaultUserAgent(), JSVGCanvas.MouseListener throws a 
NullPointerException in many of the methods (for example, mouseMoved) when it 
tries to do
    AbstractEventDispatcher dispatcher =
        (AbstractEventDispatcher)userAgent.getEventDispatcher();
    dispatcher.mouseMoved(e);
The fix is to change it to:
    AbstractEventDispatcher dispatcher =
        (AbstractEventDispatcher)userAgent.getEventDispatcher();
    if (dispatcher!=null)
      dispatcher.mouseMoved(e);

The exception generated follows. Source code examples can be generated upon 
request to aaron@pangonetworks.com -- thanks!
